page.title: 07Landscape of the Edge
page.content: On the path to the Bridestones Farm is a stone set in the wall.On the top of this stone is a cross;on the side is the letter B.This is a boundary stone between Cheshire and Staffordshire. The old barn at the farm still contained the circular holes high up through which hay or grain was passed many years ago.Beyond the farm the land was mostly rough grazing divided by stone walls.However the ridge itself was heather and bilberry amongst moorland grass.In many places this has been cleared and replanted with small conifer plantations.These are being invaded by Rhododendron.The trees are mostly Scots Pine and Larch Rowan and Silver Birch grow naturally where there is no grazing.
